```{r}
library(tidyverse)
```

## Prepare data

### Read data in - `read_csv()`

```{r}
raw_data <- read_csv("/Users/rhodgson/OBDStestdata/Week5/140915_counts_rfp_pos_single_cell2.csv")
```

### `gather()` together
Mouse id in column Typeofcount#key count #value #except for crypt number
Give data, key(new column), value #New column containing values
#Remove NAs using na.rm=true
```{r}
test_with_na <- raw_data %>% 
    gather(mouse_typeofcount, count, -crypt_no)         # This will have NAs
test_with_na
data_processed <- raw_data %>% 
    gather(mouse_typeofcount, count, -crypt_no, na.rm = TRUE)
data_processed
```

### `separate()` mouse and count type
Spliy the column mouse_typeofcount into mouse ID and the count type based on the _ as a separate
Will give a count for RFPpos and mouse id 
```{r}
data_processed <- data_processed %>% 
    separate(mouse_typeofcount, c("Mouse_ID", "count_type"), sep = "_")
data_processed
```

### `spread()` - want two columns (RFPpos, TotalCells)
Spread moves the key from count_type to make two new columns, so give key column to spread (make into two columns) and value column tto become the values 
```{r}
data_processed <- data_processed %>% 
    spread(count_type, count)    # columns we want to spread (key, value)
data_processed
```

### Do all the processing steps together
End up with RFPpos and total cells with count for each - this means each row represents one observation - this istidy data
```{r}
data_processed <- raw_data %>% 
    gather(mouse_typeofcount, count, -crypt_no, na.rm = TRUE) %>% 
    separate(mouse_typeofcount, c("Mouse_ID", "count_type"), sep = "_") %>% 
    spread(count_type, count)   
data_processed
```

### Join mouse info
Now for second table of mouse info (mouse id, sex of mouse and date)
Rename columns, then use select to reorder the coumns 
Use a left join to add in using mouse info as key into data_processed
```{r}
mouse_info <- read_csv("/Users/rhodgson/OBDStestdata/Week5/mouse_info.csv")
data_processed <- data_processed %>% 
    left_join(mouse_info) 
data_processed
# Will join by one or more col names if the same in both tables
# Sometimes you need to specify the columns to match e.g. by = c("from_name" = "to_name")

# Data is now tidy!!
```

### Rename and reorder columns
Rename columns, select to reorder the columns
```{r}
data_processed <- data_processed %>%
    rename(Crypt_number = crypt_no, Total_cells = TotalCells, Day_post_label = Day_PostLabel) %>%
    select(Mouse_ID, Sex, Crypt_number, Day_post_label, RFPpos, Total_cells)
data_processed
```

## Explore data - plots and summary analysis

### Total cells in crypts

```{r}
#Plot histogram of total cells
data_processed %>% 
    ggplot(aes(x = Total_cells)) + 
    geom_histogram()
#Plot historams of total cells for each mouse id 
data_processed %>%
    ggplot(aes(x = Total_cells)) + 
    geom_histogram() + 
    facet_wrap(~ Mouse_ID)
#Plot histogram of total cells split by day post labelled
data_processed %>%
    ggplot(aes(x = Total_cells)) + 
    geom_histogram() +
    facet_wrap(~ Day_post_label)
#SPlit histograms into a grid of day post label and sex of mouse
data_processed %>% 
    ggplot(aes(x = Total_cells)) + 
    geom_histogram() + 
    facet_grid(Sex ~ Day_post_label)
```

### Labelled cells in crypts

```{r}
#Plot histogram of the RFPos cells in crpyt
data_processed %>%
    ggplot(aes(x = RFPpos)) + 
    geom_histogram(bins = 20)
#Plot rfp cells split by day post label
data_processed %>%
    ggplot(aes(x = RFPpos)) +
    geom_histogram(bins = 20) + 
    facet_wrap(~ Day_post_label)

## Plot against each other
data_processed %>% 
    ggplot(aes(x = RFPpos, y = Total_cells, size = Mouse_ID)) + 
    geom_point() + 
    facet_wrap(~ Day_post_label)

data_processed %>% 
    ggplot(aes(x = RFPpos, y = Total_cells, col = Mouse_ID)) + 
    geom_point(alpha = 0.2) #alpha is transparency of points
```

### Proportion of labelled cells - `mutate()` to add a new column

```{r}
# Add a new column
data_processed <- data_processed %>% 
    mutate(proportion_rfp = RFPpos/Total_cells)

data_processed %>% 
    ggplot(aes(x = proportion_rfp)) + 
    geom_histogram(bins = 20) + 
    facet_wrap(~ Day_post_label)
```

### Summary statistics using `group_by()` and `summarise()`

```{r}
# Summary of numbers                                                        
data_processed %>% 
    group_by(Mouse_ID) %>% 
    summarise(num_crypts = n(), mean_rfp = mean(RFPpos), mean_num_cells = mean(Total_cells))

data_processed %>% 
    group_by(Day_post_label) %>% 
    summarise(num_crypts = n())
```

### Selecting specific rows (`filter()`) and columns (`select()`)

```{r}
# Keep only large crypts (> 15 cells)
data_processed %>% 
    filter(Total_cells > 15)

# Keep only female
data_processed %>% 
    filter(Sex == "F")

# Keep only mouse 108422-6 
data_processed %>% 
    filter(Mouse_ID == "108422-6")

# Select a few columns
data_processed %>% 
    dplyr::select(RFPpos:Day_post_label)

# Drop a column
data_processed %>% 
    dplyr::select(-Crypt_number)
```
